net.java.jddac.common.type
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.type.Location
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArgArray.ArgConverter
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocationJ2me, LocationJ2se
public abstract class Location
extends java.lang.Object
implements ArgArray.ArgConverter

Represents a geographic location. In order to support both J2SE and J2ME environments many of the interfaces utilize strings rather than floats or doubles.

containedBy

public abstract boolean containedBy(Location locSW,
                                    Location locNE)
Determine if a location is within a rectangle specified by two opposite corners.

Parameters:
locSW - - The lower left (SW) box boundary
locNE - - The upper right (NE) box boundary
Returns:
true if this object is contained by the rectangle, false otherwise.

regionOverlapsRegion

public abstract boolean regionOverlapsRegion(Location loc1SW,
                                             Location loc1NE,
                                             Location loc2SW,
                                             Location loc2NE)
Deterimine if a region overlaps another region.

Parameters:
loc1SW - The lower left region #1 corner
loc1NE - The upper right region #1 corner
loc2SW - The lower left region #2 corner
loc2NE - The upper right region #2 corner
Returns:
true if region #1 overlaps region #2

setClassInstance

public static void setClassInstance(java.lang.Class newLocationClassInstance)
Set the default Location class instance to a user specified value. This option would be used when the default LocationJ2se or LocationJ2me classes are not sufficient.

Parameters:
newLocationClassInstance -

toByteArray

public byte[] toByteArray(java.lang.Object obj)
Description copied from interface: ArgArray.ArgConverter
Convert a complex object into a byte array. If the object is not easily converted into a binary form then the function should return null. Binary encoders such as WBXML use this method for unrecognized types.

Specified by:
toByteArray in interface ArgArray.ArgConverter
Parameters:
obj - The object to convert.
Returns:
an Object representing the object.

public java.lang.String getArgTypeName()
Description copied from interface: ArgArray.ArgConverter
